result.execSummary:
The defendant Rick A. Nienow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The costs are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning July 1, 2015.

The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.   The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Wood County Case No. 14CF245.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rick A. Nienow

defendant.name: Nienow, Rick A.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: In Court Notice to Defendant After Sentencing
Request for Payment Plan, Agreement to Make Payments, and Order

Defendant Rick A. Nienow in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  District attorney moves to amend felony charge to misd bail jumping.  Defendant freely and voluntarily waives right to an attorney.  Plea of guilty  to misd bail jumping.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists. Court finds defendant guilty and orders court costs; DNA surcharge and 5 days county jail with huber and good time consecutive to Wood County Case No. 14CF245.  Jail may be served in any county where arrangements can be made with no cost to Taylor County.  Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month beginning July 1, 2015.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Rick A. Nienow in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Defendant waives the time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Court schedules for a pretrial conference. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.

Judge Knox-Bauer and the court reporter appeared by phone.  Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  Attorney Tlusty read the arrest header to the judge.  The court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $150.00 cash bond and a $2,000.00 signature bond; booking and no contact with R.R.  The court ordered a $2,5000 signature bond and booking.  The next court date is February 24, 2015 at 1:15 p.m.  - rt
